Comments:
David Horowitz's most influential time may have been when he appeared regularly on the Glenn Beck show explaining the radical left to the public.

To return to this book today is to recognize that it couldâ€™ve been published yesterday, for the issues it addresses are now even more urgent, and the bizarre ideological tendencies now even more extreme than they were then.
For a couple of years toward the end of the last century, David Horowitz contributed a regular column to the online magazine Salon.
In 1999 he gathered those columns in a book entitled Hating Whitey and Other Progressive Causes.
I think this knowledge helped set off the Tea Party movement.
(Though he has done plenty of good since then too.)
